visual_elements.description: Diagram A: Flag lot with labeled rear yard, front yard, interior side yards, showing front lot line closest and most parallel to street. Front setback is 10' instead of 20'. Buildable area shaded. Curb, lot lines, sidewalk, required setbacks indicated in key.
Diagram B: Corner lot with rear yard, interior side yard, street side yard, front yard. Street side setback is 16'. Front lot line is shortest of two frontages. Buildable area shaded.

Diagram C: Substandard corner lot with frontage less than 50 feet. Rear yard, interior side yard, street side yard, front yard labeled. Street side setback is 10' instead of 16'. Front lot line is shortest of two frontages. Buildable area shaded.
Diagram D: Through lot with rear yard, interior side yards, front yard, street labeled. Buildable area shaded.

Diagram E: Wedge shaped lot with rear yard determined by 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines. No rear lot lines. Rear yard, interior side yard, front yard, street labeled. Buildable area shaded.
Diagram F: Lot with more than 4 sides. Rear yard, interior side yard, front yard, street labeled. Rear lot line is farthest and most parallel to street. Buildable area shaded.
Diagram G: Lot with more than 4 sides. Rear yard, interior side yard, front yard, street labeled. Buildable area shaded.

technical_specifications.parameter: Standard front setback for Flag lot
Street side setback for Corner lot
Street side setback for Substandard Corner lot with frontage < 50'
Front lot line for Corner and Substandard Corner lots
technical_specifications.value: Front lot line is shortest of the two frontages

technical_specifications.parameter: Rear yard determination for Wedge shaped lots
Rear lot line for Lot with more than 4 sides
technical_specifications.value: Rear lot line is farthest and most parallel to street

structural_elements.main_heading: Determining setbacks on oddly shaped lots considerations
subheadings: Fig 17 Setbacks for oddly shaped lots

additional_notes: Page number 23 at bottom right corner
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected

All diagrams use consistent symbology as per key: solid line for curb, dashed line for lot line, patterned rectangle for sidewalk, solid thin line for required setbacks, empty rectangle for buildable area

qualifiers.text: Front lot line is closest and most parallel to street.
Front lot line is shortest of the two frontages.
Wedge shaped lots don't have rear lot lines.

conditions.text: Street side setback is 10' instead of 16'
Front lot line is shortest of the two frontages.
The rear yard is determined by a 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines.
Rear lot line is farthest and most parallel to street.
conditions.threshold_value: farthest and most parallel to street

logical_relationships.expression: If front lot line is closest and most parallel to street (q1), then front setback is 10' instead of 20' (c1).
If front lot line is shortest of the two frontages (q2), then street side setback is 10' instead of 16' (c3) and front lot line is shortest of the two frontages (c4).
If wedge shaped lots don't have rear lot lines (q3), then rear yard is determined by a 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines (c5).

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate if front lot line is closest and most parallel to street
If step 1 true, apply front setback of 10' instead of 20'
Evaluate if front lot line is shortest of two frontages
If step 3 true, apply street side setback of 10' instead of 16' and recognize front lot line as shortest frontage
Evaluate if lot is wedge shaped and has no rear lot lines
If step 5 true, determine rear yard by 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines
